Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "[A11y] Screen reader focus is not moving to last column in "Version history" table while navigating Ctrl+Alt+Right Arrow keys" (#9472) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
URL: https://devdiv.visualstudio.com/DevDiv/_workitems/edit/1745411

Environment Details:
App name: NuGet Service
#URL: [https://www.nuget.org](https://nam06.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https:%2f%2fwww.nuget.org%2f&data=05%7c01%7cv-nitipi%40microsoft.com%7c9a84307e7aa744a4b24208dafa5ca2fe%7c72f988bf86f141af91ab2d7cd011db47%7c1%7c0%7c638097573052590837%7cUnknown%7cTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7c3000%7c%7c%7c&sdata=C8Eab3i6ixAmqsOjG4AxNT36z9WZQiXPbjDDkMcS5ME%3D&reserved=0)
OS and Browser Details:
Edition Windows 11 Enterprise
OS build 22621.1105.
Chrome version:  109.0.5414.120 (Official Build) (64-bit)
Screen Reader: JAWS.

Repro Steps:
Hit the URL: https://www.nuget.org/
Navigate to "Sign in" control and hit enter.
Navigate to "Sign in with Microsoft" control and hit enter.
Search for a key term (say ‚Äújson‚Äù) from search box.
Click on "Newtonsoft.json" control and hit enter.
Navigate to "Version History" control and hit enter.
Observe whether when screen reader focus on user unable to navigate last column "Version history" table with the help of Ctrl+Alt+Right Arrow keys or not.

Actual Result:
Screen reader focus is not moving to last column in "Version history" table while navigating Ctrl+Alt+Right Arrow keys

Expected Result:
Screen reader focus should move to last column in "Version history" table while navigating Ctrl+Alt+Right Arrow keys

User Impact:
Screen reader not able to understand last column "Version history" information table. 

Recommendations:
Refer [Repository of bug fixes code snippets](https://nam06.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https:%2f%2faka.ms%2faccsnippet&data=05%7c01%7cv-samhithaks%40microsoft.com%7c535b4a834ef843acdfb508da53769f91%7c72f988bf86f141af91ab2d7cd011db47%7c1%7c0%7c637914066217264155%7cUnknown%7cTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7c3000%7c%7c%7c&sdata=xoIfLB9Iq6HVIPyUc42rS%2BlVQCt9m%2BaUokp32Kaz1nE%3D&reserved=0)

Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "[A11y] Make screen readers start with packages list on Search Page." (#9465) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
# Changes

* Gives focus to `results-column` element to tell screen readers were to start if the `Apply` button or the `Search` button were clicked.
* uses `localStorage` to track if those buttons were clicked before the page refresh.

Addresses: https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/issues/9422

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "[Bug]: dotnet nuget push not detecting apikey for 3rd party symbol server" (#11846) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
### NuGet Product Used

dotnet.exe

### Product Version

n/a

### Worked before?

_No response_

### Impact

It bothers me. A fix would be nice

### Repro Steps & Context

1. Set apikey for `myget repo v3 index`. 
2. Create nupkg + snupkg.
3. Please do `dotnet nuget push .\somepackage.1.1.0.nupkg --source myget`
It doesn't detect apikey for 3rd party symbol server, not sure if it's myget implementation issue or `nuget.client` issue. It looks workaround is pass actual apikey as parameter in cli.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8766776/171296532-6266e63e-2d71-4498-aa11-d3ae3ee1d637.png)

As you can see in fiddler log it's missing apikey header.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8766776/171298054-b8e97b07-9df5-460c-b5db-c31179335bc3.png)


4. Also do `nuget push .\somepackage.1.1.0.nupkg -source myget` then it asks for username. 
 It looks workaround is pass actual apikey as parameter in cli.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8766776/171297184-63415ecb-1e5b-4725-861c-c0db6c3d4ba0.png)




### Verbose Logs

_No response_

Events.RelatedDescription: Reopened issue "Signing:  re-enable signed package verification on Linux and macOS" (#11262) at NuGet/Home
Closed issue "[Test Failure] The vertical scrollbar is truncated in the default layout of Package Manager UI Window" (#3286) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
**Repro Steps:**
1.  New project -> Visual C# -> Web -> ASP.NET Web Application, then uncheck the box for "Application Insights".
2.  Click Web Forms template and check ‚ÄúWeb Forms‚Äù and ‚ÄúWeb API‚Äù.
3.  Change Authentication to ‚ÄúNo Authentication‚Äù and click OK button.
4.  Open ‚ÄòManage NuGet Package for Solution‚Ä¶‚Äô.
5.  Click ‚ÄúBrowse‚Äù tab and click a package.

**Expected Result:**
The vertical scrollbar in the right pane show correctly in the default layout of Package Manager UI Window.

**Actual Result:**
The vertical scrollbar in the right pane is truncated in the default layout of Package Manager UI Window as below screenshot. It thinner than normal scrollbar, so it is hard to select.
![verticalscrollbar](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/20632625/17510336/1554226e-5e51-11e6-911a-145a9cbd5aaa.png)
**Note:**
1. It happened on Dev15 Preview4 Willow install+NuGet 3.6.0-Beta1-1738.
2. It repro on Dev14 U3+NuGet 3.5.0-RTM-1737.
3. It doesn‚Äôt repro on VS2015Update3 w/ NuGet 3.4.4.
4. It will not repro after you drag the right-boundary of the window to the right side.
5. The scrollbar will disappear when you drag the right-boundary of the window to the left side.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "[Test Failure] The same package source gets two different tooltips" (#4330) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
**NuGet Version:** NuGet 4.0.0-RTM-2224
**VS Version:** D15Rel 26118.00
**OS Version:** Windows 10 RS1_Release 14393.726.170112-1758
 
**Repro Steps:**
1.  Create a new C# Console Application via VS.
2.  Right-click on the project and click ‚ÄòManage NuGet Packages‚Ä¶‚Äô.
3.  Hover on ‚ÄòPackage source‚Äô drop down list on the right-top of PM UI (default is ‚Äònuget.org‚Äô).
4.  Switch to other package source and switch back to ‚Äònuget.org‚Äô.
5.  Hover on ‚ÄòPackage source‚Äô drop down list again.

**Expected Result:**
The same package source gets same tooltips between step3 and step5.

**Actual Result:**
The same package source gets two different tooltips as below screenshot.
![differenttooltips](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/20632625/22099600/f73c8172-de66-11e6-88d7-b6f6f11f8889.png)

**Note:**
1. It repro on D15Rel 26118.00 (NuGet Client 4.0.0-RC3-2215).
2. It also repro on Dev14 MU3.5 25421.01(NuGet 3.4.4.1321).

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "[Test Failure]Project type showed ‚Äúunknown‚Äù when executing command ‚ÄúGet-Project‚Äù in PMC for .NET Core projects" (#7798) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
## Details about Problem
NuGet version: NuGet Client Dev\5.0.0.5831
Build Tools VS Version: D16.0\28613.55
OS: Windows 10 RS4_Release 17134.1.180410-1804
## Detailed repro steps 
1. Create a .NET Core/.NET Standard projects in VS.
2. Open PMC and execute command ‚ÄúGet-Project‚Äù in PMC.
## Expected
The project type showed correctly as below screenshot (e.g. ASP.NET Empty Web Site).
![correcttype](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/20632625/52775539-e05f5c00-307a-11e9-9e0f-c4249471f759.png)

## Actual
The project type showed ‚Äúunknown‚Äù as below screenshot.
![unknowntype](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/20632625/52775522-d3db0380-307a-11e9-8e5d-0cd799f82d91.png)

## Note
1. It only repro for .NET Core/.NET Standard projects.
2. It repro on D16.0\28613.55 (default NuGet Client 5.0.0.5821).
3. It repro on D15.8\27924.00 (default NuGet Client 4.8.0.5348).

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "[Test Failure][Suggestion] Link ‚Äúhttps://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/nuget/reference/migrate-packages-config-to-package-reference‚Äù should be clickable in migration-failed dialog" (#8274) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
## Details about Problem
VS Version: D16.2stg 29027.113
OS Version: 17763.RS5_Release.180914-1434.
Install VS: https://devdiv.visualstudio.com/DevDiv/_build/results?buildId=2806963&view=results
Install NuGet:       \\\ddfiles\Drops\NuGet\Drops\CI\NuGet.Client\Dev\5.2.0.6067\artifacts\VS15\NuGet.Tools.vsix
## Detailed repro steps 
1. Launch Visual Studio 2019.
2. Create a new C++ Console App project and open PM UI in Solution Explorer window.
3. Install a package (e.g. Netonsoft.json) with ‚Äúpackages.config‚Äù format into the project.
4. Right-click the ‚ÄúReference‚Äù node and select the ‚ÄúMigrate packages.config to PackageReference‚Ä¶‚Äù.
5. Observe the warning.
## Expected
‚Äúhttps://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/nuget/reference/migrate-packages-config-to-package-reference‚Äù should be a link in migration-failed dialog.
## Actual
Link ‚Äúhttps://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/nuget/reference/migrate-packages-config-to-package-reference‚Äù does not clickable in migration-failed dialog as below screenshot.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/40230425/60334817-f7ba3880-99ce-11e9-860d-80c51b44bd45.png)

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "NuGet.Tests.Apex.NetCoreProjectTestCase.UninstallPackageFromNetCoreProjectFromUI and NuGet.Tests.Apex.NetCoreProjectTestCase.UpdatePackageToNetCoreProjectFromUI are flaky" (#12441) at NuGet/Home
Closed issue "Moving to the new .NET Foundation CLA service" (#68) at NuGet/Announcements
Events.RelatedBody:
Hello everyone
The .NET Foundation is transitioning to a new CLA service and I'm posting here to let you know it's happening. Some background info:

The new CLA service is based off of https://github.com/microsoft/ContributorLicenseAgreement, except it uses the dotnet-policy-service app

- Current contributors do not need to sign the CLA again
- The CLA agreement itself is not changing
- As part of the install/configuration process, the following work items will be completed

1. Create a .github repo if it doesn't exist already
2. Install the dotnet-policy-service app
3. Create PRs for the platformcontext.xml and cla.yml files
4. Disable the existing CLA webhook
5. Push the PRs to enable the new CLA service

That's all there is to it. I'll update this issue once the work is complete

Thanks
Chris
.NET Foundation Operations team

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Moving to the new .NET Foundation CLA service" (#68) at NuGet/Announcements
Events.RelatedBody:
Hello everyone
The .NET Foundation is transitioning to a new CLA service and I'm posting here to let you know it's happening. Some background info:

The new CLA service is based off of https://github.com/microsoft/ContributorLicenseAgreement, except it uses the dotnet-policy-service app

- Current contributors do not need to sign the CLA again
- The CLA agreement itself is not changing
- As part of the install/configuration process, the following work items will be completed

1. Create a .github repo if it doesn't exist already
2. Install the dotnet-policy-service app
3. Create PRs for the platformcontext.xml and cla.yml files
4. Disable the existing CLA webhook
5. Push the PRs to enable the new CLA service

That's all there is to it. I'll update this issue once the work is complete

Thanks
Chris
.NET Foundation Operations team

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "NuGet.org migration towards a new multi-CDN infrastructure" (#60) at NuGet/Announcements
Events.RelatedBody:
In the coming weeks, nuget.org will be migrating towards a new multi-CDN infrastructure that will improve the experience of our users. This change allows our team flexibility to switch to a back-up provider in the case that one CDN is down, which will broaden coverage for our users.

Some changes are coming for older TLS cipher suites, which may result in connectivity issues. From our data we believe this will affect only a small percentage of requests. We will be monitoring all feedback channels during the migration to assess impact and adjust our roll-out timeline as needed.

Below, we provide resources to determine whether you will be affected by this change. This utilizes the [.NET CLI](https://dotnet.microsoft.com/) to install a package from our pre-production (INT) environment which tests connectivity:


```
mkdir cdn-test
cd cdn-test
dotnet new classlib
dotnet add package BaseTestPackage.NetStandard --source https://apiint.nugettest.org/v3/index.json
```

If you are experiencing connectivity issues while connecting to nuget.org or restoring packages from https://api.nuget.org/v3/index.json, such as:

"The SSL connection could not be established"

Please ensure that TLS 1.2 and any of the following cipher suites have been enabled on your machine:

TLS_ECDHE_RSA_WITH_AES_256_GCM_SHA384
TLS_ECDHE_RSA_WITH_AES_128_GCM_SHA256
TLS_DHE_RSA_WITH_AES_256_GCM_SHA384
TLS_DHE_RSA_WITH_AES_128_GCM_SHA256

If you have any questions, do reach out to us at‚ÄØsupport@nuget.org or by commenting on the discussion issue:‚ÄØNuGet/Home#11058
